posts.content:
DragonatorXII wrote:Obviously dexterity based. I'd like it to be survivable in leveling. Though, I also want it to be as strong as possible in player vs. player. My preferred race is Human, and I don't have any preference regarding weapons or classes, besides obviously assassin. I'd like to have the highest DC as possible and death attack, and the most damage output possible. Thanks!
Hey man!

So, it seems to me that you want a little bit too much for this build. Here's what I mean:

- AC and survivability means DEX, which can also be AB with Weapon Finesse, so if you had said I want an assassin build with survivability, I would say good, let's try to build it then! However...

- Damage output means STR, which is mutually exclusive with DEX, meaning that if you put one point in DEX, it's one less point you put in STR and vice-versa. There are alternative ways of increasing the damage output of a DEX build. those are: WS / EWS, Sneak Attacks, Traps, dual-wielding and buffs. So, you will never even come close to a STR build in terms of damage, but you can have alternatives.

For more Sneak Attacks, you'd have to be a Rogue / Assassin, that would also be good because of the skill points. You can complement that with some Fighter levels for some feats and EWS and you have yourself an OK build in terms of damage dealing with good survivability.

Supposing you go Fighter / Rogue / Assassin, to get Epic Dodge, you'd need at least 13 Rogue levels, BUT, that would lower your DA DC by a lot. Epic Dodge is great to have in a DEX build, so the question is: would you be willing to sacrifice Death Attack DC for it?

Take it EZ!

posts.content: No. I would rather have Death Attack DC for sure.

That can be arranged.

Now, if you want DA DC, you can go for Assassin 18, which is the highest attainable at a 30th level cap level that grants you a bonus feat. That leaves another 12 levels to be split between Rogue and Fighter. You can do 4 Fighter to get EWS, 6 if you want to have it as a bonus feat, which would leave 6 levels for Rogue, but Rogue 6 and Rogue 4 is almost the same, except for 1d6 Sneak Attack, so I would say the best spread is Fighter 8 Rogue 4 Assassin 18. You'd need to take Rogue 4 Fighter 6 Assassin 10 pre-epic, or even Fighter 7 Assassin 9 Rogue 4 (either is fine).

I'll see what I can build when I have some spare time, which is not now. maybe later today I will.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
NIce build Max!
I will suggest one tweak right off the bat.
If you make it F8/R3/A19 with F7/R3/A10 pre epic, you gain +1 to the DC and +1d6 DA damage. The price is -4 skillpoint and -1 refl save bonus.

The build has trap skills to handle standard epic traps. I don't know if epic traps are available on Arelith. If handling standard deadly traps (except setting deadly gas traps) is enough, you can save 40 skillpoints with Disable trap 11 (16), Search 16 (21) and Set trap 5 (16).

One way to get higher hitpoints, is to lower intelligence from 16 to 14. Con 12 will give +30 HP and +1 to fort saves. The other two buy points can be spent for strength 15 with better carrying capacity and higher damage 50 % of the time when buffing str (unless str is capped). Alternatively you can start with wis 10 for +1 to will saves, but I like strength better. The price is -1 to DC and - 33 skillpoints.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: Well, a Monk / Fighter / Assassin would have more attacks per round, more movespeed, but less Sneak Attack damage (2d6). I'd say the Monk / Fighter / Assassin is probably better.
